tasks.task: Converting Prairie Pothole Region for Agriculture with Conservation Efforts
subtasks: Draining wetlands and converting tallgrass prairie to farmland (corn, soybeans)
Implementing conservation practices (e.g., riparian buffers, filter strips) to mitigate water pollution
Restoring wetlands and prairies to enhance biodiversity and reduce agricultural runoff
Adopting precision farming techniques (e.g., ridge tillage, band fertilizers) to reduce nutrient leaching
Establishing wildlife habitats (e.g., prairie remnants, riparian forest buffers) for migratory species and water quality
Recognizing the impact of glacial till and moraines on current landscape features
Addressing natural erosion processes (e.g., waterfalls, incised drainages) in agricultural management
Balancing historical watershed development with current farming practices

tasks.task: Humanity's Historical Impact on the Landscape
subtasks: Notes on prehistoric inhabitants (Plains Indians, bison) and their influence
Challenges faced by early settlers in adapting to the turbulent landscape
Agricultural expansion and the drainage of wetlands (2.5 million acres in Iowa)
Engaging private landowners in conservation efforts (e.g., Minnesota Conservation Reserve Enhancement Program)
Addressing the zone of hypoxia in the Gulf of Mexico through collaborative watershed management
Balancing agricultural production with environmental stewardship in the Upper Midwest
Conservation-minded family working within economic viability
Tailoring conservation practices to individual farm needs (e.g., monitoring local water quality, adjusting tillage timing)
